newsitem.title: USA: Boston kids surf on-line porn in library - report.
newsitem.headline: Boston kids surf on-line porn in library - report.

text.p: Children are using the Boston Public Library's access to the Internet to view pornography, the Boston Herald reported Wednesday.
Parent John Hunt told the newspaper he was furious to learn that his 11-year-old daughter was able to view pornography at the library while she was working on a school essay.

"She said all the boys were around the computer and they were laughing and called the girls over to look at pictures of naked people," Hunt told the newspaper. "I want to find out from these library officials what is going on."
Library spokesman Arthur Dunphy, who could not be immediately reached for comment, told the Herald, "We do have children's librarians, but we don't have Internet police."

Dunphy told the newspaper that a Philadelphia federal court decision last year banned the government from forcing libraries to censor materials on the Internet for children because it violated their First Admendment rights.
Meanwhile, Boston's City Council is expected to hold a meeting Wednesday to demand action.
"I'm a believer in early learning, but not this kind of early learning," City Councilor Peggy Davis-Mullen told the Herald.
